articles.author: Hannah Knowles
articles.title: Covid-19 live updates: WHO Europe head says vaccine booster shots 'not a luxury' and help protect the vulnerable - The Washington Post
articles.description: The World Health Organization has previously urged wealthy nations to hold off on booster shots of the coronavirus vaccine until people in poorer countries can get their first doses.
articles.content: BRUSSELS The European Union is recommending that its 27 member countries reinstate restrictions on American travelers, a change that would primarily affect unvaccinated people, as soaring rates of ne… [+1457 chars]

articles.author: Elian Peltier
articles.title: Unvaccinated U.S. Visitors Could Face New Restrictions on Travel to Europe - The New York Times
articles.description: The European Union’s leaders removed the United States from a “safe list.” Individual countries in the bloc are not obliged to follow suit, however.
articles.content:
Most countries in the bloc do not require Americans to isolate upon arrival, but a few have kept quarantine requirements in place this summer, including, in some cases, for inoculated visitors.
Stil… [+1339 chars]

articles.author: The Star Online
articles.title: Coronavirus booster shots 'not a luxury', WHO Europe head says - The Star Online
articles.description: COPENHAGEN (Reuters) -A third-dose booster shot of the COVID-19 vaccination is a way to keep the most vulnerable safe and "not a luxury", the World Health Organization said on Monday.
articles.content:
COPENHAGEN (Reuters) -A third-dose booster shot of the COVID-19 vaccination is a way to keep the most vulnerable safe and "not a luxury", the World Health Organization said on Monday.
